meanings.definition: To prevent from saving or accumulating money.
meanings.sent1: Spending all your earnings dissaves your ability to save for the future.
meanings.sent2: Not saving any money dissaves your chances of having extra funds for emergencies.
meanings.sent3: Trying to buy everything you see dissaves your wallet from growing.
meanings.sent4: Constantly splurging on unnecessary items dissaves your financial stability.
meanings.sent5: Ignoring the importance of saving dissaves your financial well-being over time.

meanings.definition: To cause a loss of savings or financial security.
meanings.sent1: Unexpected expenses can dissaves your hard-earned savings quickly.
meanings.sent2: Investing in risky ventures may dissaves your financial stability in the long run.
meanings.sent3: Forgetting to pay bills on time dissaves your financial peace of mind.
meanings.sent4: Being careless with money dissaves your ability to build a secure future.
meanings.sent5: A sudden job loss can dissaves your financial safety net.
